plugin.comment:
The inputs are not defined where they were for Halo 3, but instead are in the "Compiled Widget Data" block at the bottom, along with the 3 blocks within "State Data".
...Unless the State Data block is part of HUD Widgets not Bitmap/Text Widgets, which THOSE states are defined at the bottom of the HUD Widgets block.
There is no outright index for Compiled Widget Data so use the Import Inputs/States and counting (Bitmap and Text Widgets only!) to find it.
Mapping the Trigger indexes will take time. There is a block at the bottom of CHGD with an unsorted list of triggers with a vague category, which has been sorted into a comment about the block.
As for Placement Data, each index likely refers to each "HUD Attributes" index in CHGD to change depending on resolution.
While represented as an enum, it is actually an index to the "HUD Shaders" block in CHGD.
Only select "Use Parent Widget" for a Bitmap or Text Widget, otherwise the game will crash.

tagblock.name: HUD Widgets
State Data
tagblock.comment: The following blocks are import data.

tagblock.name: State Data
tagblock.comment: The following blocks are import data.

bit.name: Offset Sprite Index By Biped Type
Offset Sprite Index By Range Input

rect16.name: Manual Texture Coordinates
rect16.tooltip: This defines the visible rectangle for the bitmap if the bit of the same name is set. For ammo counters, L/R should be a multiple of 8, and T/B a multiple of 12.

tagblock.name: Text Widgets
State Data
tagblock.comment: The following blocks are import data.

This value can be anything from the hud_messages unicode tag, or one of the following, where a-f correspond to Output Scalars a-f in the Render Data block: chud_out_a chud_out_b chud_out_c chud_out_d chud_out_e chud_out_f chud_variant_name chud_variant_objective_variant chud_variant_objective chud_variant_objective_designator chud_talking_player_name chud_arming_meter_name chud_time_left chud_training_text chud_nav_point chud_scripted_objective_text chud_scripted_chapter_title_text chud_scripted_training_text chud_campaign_objective_text chud_ft_member_1_name chud_ft_member_2_name chud_ft_member_3_name chud_ft_member_name chud_ft_member_1_kill_count chud_ft_member_2_kill_count chud_ft_member_3_kill_count chud_ft_member_kill_count chud_campaign_ft_member_1_name chud_campaign_ft_member_2_name chud_campaign_ft_member_3_name chud_campaign_ft_member_4_name chud_campaign_ft_member_5_name chud_campaign_ft_member_name chud_campaign_ft_member_1_service_tag chud_campaign_ft_member_2_service_tag chud_campaign_ft_member_3_service_tag chud_campaign_ft_member_4_service_tag chud_campaign_ft_member_5_service_tag chud_campaign_ft_member_service_tag chud_megalo_datasource_omni_widget_label chud_megalo_datasource_omni_widget_value chud_megalo_progress_bar_label chud_datasource_scripted_object_text chud_datasource_tracked_target_text chud_location_name chud_commendation_callout_text chud_datasource_progression_toast_text chud_datasource_scripted_object_priority_text chud_datasource_scripted_object_priority_description_text
Since the states values are dynamic, this enum is used to determine where the next "X States" data starts, even if the block was empty.
Since the states values are dynamic, these bits are used to determine where the triggers that have the "Input Variable" flag checked are.

Uses this format:
-States (Yes, No) Count ("Unknown" States not used here!) Then for every States count: -Triggers Count Then for every Triggers count: -Trigger Index
Repeats for both States blocks. Use a 0 if the block is null. It is currently unknown what the criteria is for more than one "X States" index. Check existing tags for examples, good luck.

tagblock.name: Compiled Widget Data
tagblock.comment: Since the states values are dynamic, these bits are used to determine where the triggers that have the "Input Variable" flag checked are.
Since the states values are dynamic, this enum is used to determine where the next "X States" data starts, even if the block was empty.

Uses this format:
-States (Yes, Unknown, No) Count Then for every States count: -Triggers Count Then for every Triggers count: -Trigger Index
Repeats for all 3 States blocks. Use a 0 if the block is null. It is currently unknown what the criteria is for more than one "X States" index. Check existing tags for examples, good luck.
